description.narrative: Monitoring and Evaluation: The Government has a National Statistics Development Framework for improved child rights reporting and accountability., which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2023, government institutions at the national and regional level are routinely reporting on the realization of the rights of all children and adolescents .

sector.narrative: Building global / regional / national stakeholder evaluation capacity
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

title.narrative: Namibia United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Namibia 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Monitoring and Evaluation: The Government has a National Statistics Development Framework for improved child rights reporting and accountability.

description.narrative: Recognising the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, the National Statistics Agency (NSA) produced the first national SDGs Baseline Report. The document serves as a key reference for Namibia's monitoring of progress towards achieving SDG targets. Moreover, the Government of the Republic of Namibia together with UN partners developed and launched the Sustainable Development Goals Fifth National Development Plan Indicator Framework. Its purpose is to reflect the level of alignment of NDP5 indicator framework with SDGs, minimise duplication and redundancies in data collection and reduce response fatigue. UNICEF continues to support overall architecture and functionality of sectoral Management Information Systems | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/01/2020

title.narrative: Full Sustainable Statistics Development Framework in place and implemented
Number of sectoral MIS supported by UNICEF which produce quaterly reports/ dashboards
Number of Key National Studies and Surveys reflecting child focused data (DHS, Census, VAC,Child Poverty Study)
Existence of a streamlined indicator framework for all programming areas under a comprehensive COVID-19 response (for both immediate and long-term monitoring of impact)
